alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 02 at 2:23PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 420 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 420 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 221 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southeastern Anza, Hwy 79 Between Warner Springs And Oak Grove, Warner Springs, Hwy 79 Between Oak Grove And Aguanga, Hwy 79 Between Santa Ysabel And Warner Springs, Borrego Palm Canyon, Hwy 74 Between Mountain Center And Anza, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Hwy 74 Between Anza And Palm Desert and Aguanga. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
